"""
## Walkthrough

A new Express router module is added to handle device alert management. This module introduces endpoints for creating alerts, checking device values against alert conditions (and sending notifications), retrieving alerts by ID, and deleting alerts. The implementation includes error handling and uses Device and Alert models along with a notification service.

## Changes

| File(s)                       | Change Summary                                                                                                         |
|------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| src/api/routes/controller.js | New Express router module with endpoints for alert creation, checking, retrieval, and deletion.                         |
| docs/script.js                | Refactored chart rendering: replaced Venn diagram with horizontal bar chart for overlaps; simplified rendering logic.  |
| scripts/aggregate_reviews.py | Removed 'Copilot' from tool identifiers; simplified overlap counting and output data to only include intersection counts.|
| docs/index.html               | Cleaned HTML by removing blank lines, renamed chart heading, and removed unused Venn chart script import.              |

## Sequence Diagram(s)

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant Client
    participant Router
    participant DeviceModel
    participant AlertModel
    participant NotificationService

    Client->>Router: POST / (create alert)
    Router->>DeviceModel: Verify device exists
    alt Device exists
        Router->>AlertModel: Save alert
        Router-->>Client: Alert created
    else Device not found
        Router-->>Client: Error response
    end

    Client->>Router: POST /check/:deviceId (check alerts)
    Router->>AlertModel: Get alerts for device
    loop For each alert
        Router->>Router: Evaluate condition
        alt Condition met
            Router->>NotificationService: Send email
        end
    end
    Router-->>Client: Return triggered alerts

    Client->>Router: GET /:alertId (get alert)
    Router->>AlertModel: Find alert by ID
    alt Found
        Router-->>Client: Return alert
    else Not found
        Router-->>Client: Error response
    end

    Client->>Router: DELETE /:alertId (delete alert)
    Router->>AlertModel: Delete alert by ID
    alt Deleted
        Router-->>Client: Success response
    else Not found
        Router-->>Client: Error response
    end
```
